page.title: 07INDUSTRY IN GAINSBOROUGH
page.content: For a long time Gainsborough relied on one type of industry.In the C18 and C19 the port was important and jobs were created around the port.Boat building,rope making and warehousing. When the railway arrived in 1849 the port was not used as much and the towns mains industry was engineering. For many years Marshalls on Trinity Street and Roses on Ropery Road were the two main employers in the town. During the first world war,Marshalls helped to produce tanks.In the second world war,Marshalls made armaments and parts for submarines.They also made road rollers.Roses factory made packaging and wrapping machines.In world war two parts for Lancaster Bombers were made.Aveling Marshalls has now been sold to various companies.Track Marshalls tractors are made in the main factory.
